page.title: 01Newmarket & Stud Farms
page.content: Newmarket (blocks 1,2 & 5) is the headquarters of the British Horse Racing industry. It is unique in that it has training establishments actually in the town. Walkways are provided so horses can go from the stables to the heath where they are trained. The heath is extensive and lies to the NE and SW of the town (blocks 2, 3 & 4). Different gallops are open for training at different times of the year. The heath is private land maintained by the Jockey Club. The public is allowed on in the afternoons only. The residential area (blocks 1 & 2) is unlikely to grow as most available land has been developed. The north side of Ashley Road (blocks 3 & 4 also 8) is stud farmland. SE of Newmarket the land is mainly studs used for breeding racehorses. Special features of the
